Package ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.view

Class SearchResultsTable

java.lang.Object
ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.view.View
ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.view.SearchResultsTable
public class SearchResultsTable extends View
This large class is used to construct a table of toys, pretty printed for the user, with indexes for user selection or differnetiation.
Author:
Bryce Carson

  • Field Details

    • rowSelectorDigitLength

      private int rowSelectorDigitLength
      The length of the longest digits, zero-padded, which are used to select a row and which are printed to the left of a row.

    • minimumFieldWidths

      private int[] minimumFieldWidths
      The minimum width of the field widths, if the content of the fields are never longer than the headers. That is, the width of the headers in the field.

    • searchResultsToyList

      private final ArrayList<Toy> searchResultsToyList
      The toylist which this search results table will display.

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchResultsTable

      public SearchResultsTable(ArrayList<Toy> toyList)
      Constructs and pretty prints a table of toys.
      Parameters:
      toyList - The array list of toys for which to display.

    • SearchResultsTable

      public SearchResultsTable(ArrayList<Toy> placeholderToyList, boolean placeholderConstructorPredicate)
      This is a placeholder constructor. It should only be used when declaring a search results table which is truly initialized within conditional logic, and which thus causes compiler complaints.
      Parameters:
      placeholderToyList - A placeholder toylist which is only used to avoid compiler errors.
      placeholderConstructorPredicate - A boolean value, which can be true or false, it doesn't matter, to force the use of this constructor vs the other constructor.

    • promptPurchaseToyOrQuit

      public int promptPurchaseToyOrQuit()
      This method prints the search results from the search method performed in a pretty table. The 0th option (which is actually taken in as Q from the user [digits are for purchasing a toy, and zero is for canceling a "transaction" or lookup.])
      Returns:
      An integer indicating which toy in the array list the user wishes to "purchase". A return value of 0 is reserved for voiding/canceling the in-progress transaction.
